Pop icon Madonna was recently hospitalized for several days due to a serious bacterial infection, leading to the postponement of her upcoming “Celebration” tour. Her manager reported that she is still under medical care, but is expected to make a full recovery. The tour was set to begin on July 15 in Vancouver and to last seven months, highlighting songs from the past 40 years of her career. Tickets for her “Celebration” shows in New York, London, Paris and Amsterdam sold out in minutes. The tour was to span about 40 cities before concluding in Mexico City on Jan. 30, 2024. Madonna had collaborated with The Weeknd and Playboi Carti on the single “Popular” prior to the postponement of the tour, bringing her back to Billboard’s Hot 100 chart for the first time in years. A new start date for the tour has not been announced.
